history.content:
In F18, we have expanded the use of the 999 and 999A sections for CS classes.

When you want to enroll into a CS course, enroll into the lecture and the associated 999 section(s) only. 

For planning purposes, you can see the action section information on classes.berkeley.edu even though you cannot select those sections during enrollment on CalCentral.

Selection and assignment into the actual section(s) will happen outside of CalCentral and varies by course. Some courses notify students prior to the first class, while others discuss section assignments during the first lecture. After enrollment, the best recommendation is to wait for the instructor to provide additional information about section assignments and to make sure you attend the first lecture.

Why do it this way?

We created this process to prevent students from being dropped to the bottom of the wait list every time they try to switch sections by dropping and re-enrolling.

Yes, it is difficult to be patient to know how to sign up for your actual sections, but trust us, it's better than the stress of being dropped to the end of the wait list when you try to switch sections. :-)
